column1: #Text=Dublin Pride 2018 attracts tens of thousands of people
#Text=On Saturday , the Lesbian , Gay , Bisexual and Transgender ( LGBT ) Pride in the Irish capital Dublin attracted a record number of people .
#Text=According to the organisers of the Pride , about 60 thousand people attended the event , almost double the number of attendees in last year 's Pride .
#Text=Defence Forces attended the annual Pride in their military uniforms for the first time
#Text=For the first time , members of the Defence Forces attended the annual rally in their military uniforms , The Independent reported .
#Text=The Defence Forces were led by Vice-Admiral Mark Mellett .
#Text=This year 's theme was " We Are Family " .
#Text=Buildings were decorated in the colours of the rainbow on the eve of the 25th anniversary of the Dublin Pride .
#Text=According to reports , ex-president Mary McAleese and children 's minister Katherine Zappone had attended the Pride .

#Text=On June 19 , Irish Taoiseach Leo Varadkar , who is the country 's first openly-gay Taoiseach addressed the Dáil saying ,  Today the people I want to pay a special tribute to are the unknown heroes , the thousands of people whose names we do not know , who were criminalised by our forbears " .

column1: #Text=Same-sex marriage is illegal in the neighbouring country of Northern Ireland .

#Text=Mary Lou McDonald , leader of the Sinn Féin political party said , " We stand in solidarity to those in the North who are still struggling to have their families recognised in the most basic of ways - marriage equality " .
#Text=She added , saying , " The people here , the people of pride are an unstoppable force .
